page.title: 05THE GHOSTS OF SHREWLEY
page.content:
The Shrewley area is supposed to have a number of ghosts which haunt and roam about Shrewley. They are all connected to the BATTLE OF EDGE HILL, which was the first main battle of the Civil War (1642-1649). Local legend says that hundreds of Cavaliers were butchered by forces coming South during the night while they were asleep. This happened a few days before the actual battle.
Local SUPERSTITIOUS inhabitants say that they rise at regular intervals to gain revenge on the Roundheads.
Although Warwickshire was under the command of the King, the ordinary people preferred Parliament.
